r.
But it wasn't Rodimus's fault. The only one's to blame was Remus: onle
h=

Has he dashed towar=

iradiating from all his body.=
 He was trying to get to Cyclonus.

amed between them, first from between Cyclonus' hands

en sparks began to jump all along them. For a moment

round as powerful electrical fields danced in

ies darkend as clouds before the sun, and

he ground for a moment sprawled out

is optics going yellow then orange

sing into the air Cyclonus' feet merged and boosters replaced them

bout Cyclonus had changed with the defeat of this foe. He

ed, his armor burned and desnted in many places, cracks

s full length and yet he was subtly different. He took

er

" Cyclonus word was clear and final, his face still somber. "He has

n as a warrior, and I will allow him to be buried by his fellows."

The red targetting beams winked off and Rodimus resumed his normal hue.

s

ht of Rodimus they will not be able to stand against us."

d in approval.

nd as several

h the rest

nus asked

ge's voice full of eagerness. "everything is going
